intro: Ceratotheca integribracteata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has velvety, dark green leaves with a waxy texture, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The flowers typically bloom in spring and summer, adding vibrant color to gardens and indoor spaces.
